results.title: Captured in time: favourites from the sixties from the Cinesound / Movietone newsreels.
results.brief_description: In the years before television, millions of Australians made the weekly pilgramage to cinemas to catch the latest edition of the Cinesound and Movietone News. This video includes newsreels of the last lamplighter in Australia and the visit of American President, Lyndon B. Johnson.

results.title: Captives of care
results.creator_credit: Don Catchlove, Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative and Stephen Wallace
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of events which occurred at “Leumah”, a residential institution for physically handicapped adults, during 1973. Tells of the residents’ struggle to gain a measure of autonomy, and the obstacles which were put in their way. Adapted from the book “Captives of Care” by John Roarty. Cast includes: Julieanne Newbould, Pat Thomson, Kay Taylor, Phillip Hinton, Tony Ward and John Roarty.

results.title: Captive minds: hypnosis and beyond
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis, David Wilson, Adam Symansky and Pierre Lasry
results.brief_description: From stage hypnosis to group and individual therapies and long-term conditioning, “Captive minds: hypnosis and beyond” explores the power of suggestion and its ability to influence behaviour - sometimes for life. By focusing on such disparate institutions as an Indian ashram, a United States Marines training camp, a monastery, and the Moonie cult, the film reveals the striking similarities in the indoctrination methods each uses to achieve long-term effects. It is a film that serves as a reminder that we are all vulnerable to persuasion, and one that provokes serious consideration of the far-reaching implications of any form of psychological manipulation. Awards: San Francisco; Montreal
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis, David Wilson, Adam Symansky and Pierre Lasry

results.title: Captivated
results.creator_credit: Piers Piers Godden, Dangerous to Know and David Squire
results.brief_description: Written and performed by Rikki Beadle Blair, “Captivated” is a one-man theatre piece that tells the story of Shane, a gay black man imprisoned for murder. The monotony of his daily routine is broken by letters from a “pink” pen pal, a gay Asian man who writes to Shane as an act of charity. Their correspondence charts Shane’s personal journey from self-hatred, which has manifested in a personal history of violence, to agonised self-reflection, and finally a new found gratitude and respect for his unseen friend. Dynamically staged and produced, with a bravura performance of isolation and redemption by Blair, an award-winning actor and writer on British TV.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Piers Piers Godden, Dangerous to Know and David Squire

results.title: Captains, barges and canals
results.brief_description: A lighthearted presentation of Germany’s inland waterways. Barges provide the cheapest form of transport, and carry one third of Germany’s goods. Follows the barges and their families on the highways and byways of the canals, showing the surrounding country-side; the many types of barges; the traffic problems; slow operating lochs, and customs and police inspections. No other credits available.

results.title: Captain Socceroo 2-Individual Skills Coaching
results.brief_description: Individual skills coaching has 26 alternative coaching segments designed to assist the player who is practicing by himself without the aid of other players. Presented by John Doyle.

results.title: Captain Socceroo 1-Team Skills Coaching
results.brief_description: John Doyle presents his famous soccer skills segments in two cassettes. “Teams skill coaching” looks at 26 different soccer skills that can be practised by teams or several players together. Presented by John Doyle.

results.title: Captain Pugwash Seafaring Tales
results.brief_description: Attention me hearties! Here’s another chance to watch that bravest of buccaneers, Captain Pugwash, and his trusty band of pirates, in nine salty tales from the hugely popular 1960s and 70s series. Thrill to their swash- buckling adventures aboard the Black Pig as cunning cabin boy Tom helps Captain Pugwash and his loyal crew battle against their arch-enemy Cut Throat Jake. Their adventures involve an hilarious smuggling escapade, doughnuts for dodos and even a promising career in the theatre … but is it the end for Captain Pugwash when he faces the chopper? Rated: G

results.title: Captain Noah and his floating zoo
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International, Douglas Terry, Bridget Appleby, Peter Clark and Brian Cosgrove
results.brief_description: The story of Noah and his Ark, told in words, animation and music. God had created a world and set mankind on it, but when He looked down on His people He saw only sinning and selfishness. But He found Noah, the only good man left, living outside the walls of Fun City, and told him in a dream what He was going to do. Music by Joseph Horovitz and lyrics by Michael Flanders.
